title: Remove ZIP build export from the app

requirements.summary: Remove the Diagnostics bar "Build Export" UI card/section and all ZIP-related user-facing copy while keeping other diagnostics features unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: In the Diagnostics bar, there is no "Build Export" card/section visible.
No user-facing text anywhere in the app mentions downloading a ZIP, extracting a ZIP, or "Download Frontend Build (ZIP)".
The rest of the Diagnostics bar (build info, copy diagnostics, performance check) still renders and functions as before.

file_operations.description: Delete the entire "Build Export" Card section (download button, progress text, and deployment instructions) from the Diagnostics bar UI. Remove related React state, handlers, icons, and imports (including exportFrontendBuild/downloadBlob) so the remaining Diagnostics bar sections continue to render and function as before.

requirements.summary: Remove the ZIP export implementation and any ZIP-only logic so the frontend can no longer generate or download ZIP files.
acceptanceCriteria: The frontend codebase has no runtime path that generates a .zip Blob for build export.
DiagnosticsBar no longer imports or references ZIP-export-related functions/modules (e.g., '@/lib/buildExport').
The application builds successfully with no unused/invalid imports after removing ZIP export code paths.

file_operations.description: Remove the build export module that fetches app assets and assembles a ZIP Blob for download (including the download helper), since it is only used for ZIP export.
Remove the in-browser ZIP writer implementation that exists solely to support the build export ZIP creation path.

After removing the ZIP-export UI, ensure all ZIP-export-related imports/references are removed (e.g., '@/lib/buildExport') so there is no remaining runtime path that can generate or download ZIP files, and the app compiles cleanly without unused imports.
